revised_title: Comparison of Magnetic Observations in the Northern and Southern Hemispheres
tldr: The author discusses the differences in magnetic observations between the Northern and Southern Hemispheres, specifically focusing on the regular daily magnetic variation (SR) at sub-auroral latitudes. They propose that this phenomenon could be related to a current circulating around the auroral zone and may be linked to the SR variation inside polar caps. Further research is suggested to understand the source of this phenomenon.
